page.title: 14Sexey's Hospital.
page.content: Hugh Sexey was born in Bruton in the mid 16th century. Later to become auditor to Queen Elizabeth I, he became a wealthy man and a great benefactor to his home town. Besides leaving money to promote education in Bruton, his will made provision for the establishment of Almshouses. The Almshouses, or Sexey's Hospital as it is now known, were built in the early 17th century. The chapel and the buildings around the quadrangle were the first to be built, and a new block of buildings were added in 1882. It was at this time that the outside staircases and balcony to the rooms were added. The first inmates of the Hospital were 12 elderly men and women; in 1985, there are 20 residents, looked after by the Master and the Matron.
